page.title: 06EDUCATION IN BLEWBURY
page.content: NO RECORDS EXIST OF EARLY SCHOOL IN BLEWBURY.A'MR.GRIFFITH,OUR SCHOOLMASTER'IS MENTIONED IN 1622 AND WILLIAM ANSTEY,IS RECORDED AS TEACHING IN 1685.THE OLD SCHOOL ORIGINATED AS A RESULT OF A BEQUEST"FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE POOR OF BLEWBURY"BY WILLIAM MALTHUS,A NATIVE OF THE VILLAGE,IN 1700 HE HAD DIRECTED THAT THE BISHOP OF THE DIOCESE(SALISBURY IN THOSE DAYS)SHOULD PROVIDE A SCHEME FOR ALLOCATING THE MONEY.THE BISHOP'S SCHEME WAS THEREFORE TO ESTABLISH A CHARITY SCHOOL.NOTHING COULD BE DONE FOR SOME TIME,BUT IN 1707 A HOUSE WAS RENTED AND A SCHOOL FOR FIFTY POOR CHILDREN STARTED.LAND WAS PURCHASED AT NOKE,NEAR OXFORD,AND THE RENTS FROM THIS PROVIDED THE INCOME FOR THE SCHOOL.SO,IN 1709,THE SCHOOLHOUSE WAS BUILT ON LAND BOUGHT FOR THE PURPOSE.
